intro: Millotia incurva, commonly known as the drooping millotia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators. Millotia incurva is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
